mountains.name: Mount Bierstadt
mountains.funFact: Is name after Albert Bierstadt. He was an American landscape painter who also happened to make the first recorded summit of the peak in 1863

mountains.name: Torreys Peak
mountains.funFact: Thanks to its breezy standard hiking route and its proximity to the Denver metro area, 14,267-foot Torreys Peak remains one of Colorado’s most popular 14ers to summit.

mountains.name: Mount Sherman
mountains.funFact: Mt Sherman is named for the U.S. General William Tecumseh Sherman

mountains.name: Mount Bross
mountains.funFact: In 2005, the summit of Mount Bross was closed to the public because of safety concerns related to mines and trail access through private land.

mountains.name: Grays Peak
mountains.funFact: Grays peak named for the botanist who introduced Charles Darwin’s theory of natural selection to the U.S.

mountains.name: Mount Elbert
mountains.funFact: Mount Elbert is also known as ‘Gentle Giant’ that tops all other rocky mountains.

mountains.name: Quandary Peak
mountains.funFact: Quandary peak was named after miners who found unidentified and named mineral on the peaks slope.

mountains.name: Mount Democrat
mountains.funFact: Mount Democrat was named by some Southern minders during the Civil War in protest to nearby Mount Lincoln.

mountains.name: Mount Massive
mountains.funFact: Mount Massive has more area about 14,000 feet than any mountain in the United States, outside of Alaska.

mountains.name: Mount Belford
mountains.funFact: Mount Belford is often climbed in tandem with its neighbor Mount Oxford

mountains.name: Pikes Peak
mountains.funFact: Pikes peak was the reason Kathrine Lee Bates wrote “America the Beautiful”

mountains.name: Longs Peak
mountains.funFact: Loans Peak is the only 14er in the Rocky Mountain National Park

mountains.name: Mount Evans
mountains.funFact: The highest paved road in North America leads to Mount Evan

mountains.name: Mount Lincoln
mountains.funFact: Mount Lincoln was named in honor of Abraham Lincoln, 16th President of the United States.
